summary: This is an email chain from July 26, 2019, between attorneys and paralegals at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, forwarding a Bloomberg news article and related emails about Jeffrey Epstein's connections to Leslie Wexner, L Brands/Victoria's Secret, and his use of specific email accounts. It highlights Epstein's interactions with models and executives, and includes a forwarded 2003 email proposing an investment opportunity.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney forwarding emails and information about Epstein's email habits and connections to L Brands.

persons.name: Sandra Perkins
persons.role: Paralegal at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Paralegal who forwarded the Bloomberg article and related emails about Epstein's ties to L Brands and his assistant's email address.

persons.name: Aneisha Christie
persons.context: Copied on the internal email forwarding the Bloomberg article about Epstein and Wexner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central subject of the emails; discussed regarding his email accounts, connections to L Brands/Victoria's Secret, models, private island, plane, and his 'Little Black Book'.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Described as having deep ties to Epstein, providing him with a plane and property access; his contact details are extensively listed in Epstein's black book.

persons.name: Ed Razek
persons.context: L Brands executive who helps select Victoria's Secret models; was invited by Epstein to his Manhattan mansion in 2005 and corresponded with him via email.

persons.name: William Mook
persons.context: Presented an investment opportunity to Ed Razek and Epstein in September 2005; noted the presence of young women claiming to be models at Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the famous friends Epstein shuttled on his Boeing 727 jet.

persons.name: Michael O'Neil
persons.context: Sent an email in 2005 inviting Epstein to a North American regional meeting in Montreal.

persons.name: Meredith Schultz
persons.context: Copied on an internal email from Sandra Perkins about Epstein's connection to Limited Brands/Sellmax.

connections.description: Wexner provided Epstein with a Boeing 727 jet and access to properties; Epstein had extensive contact details for Wexner in his black book. Wexner praised Epstein as a loyal friend with excellent judgment.
Epstein corresponded and met with Razek, an L Brands executive; invited him to his Manhattan mansion in 2005 where models were present.
Mook presented an investment opportunity to Epstein and Razek in September 2005, meeting at Epstein's mansion.
Clinton is noted as a famous friend whom Epstein shuttled on his private jet.
Attorney and paralegal at the same law firm collaborating on case information regarding Epstein's email accounts and connections.

events.title: Investment Pitch at Epstein's Mansion
events.description: William Mook presented an investment opportunity to Ed Razek and Jeffrey Epstein at Epstein's Manhattan mansion, where they were welcomed by young women who said they were working as models for Epstein.

events.title: Trip to Abigail Plantation
events.description: Epstein used his jet (originally from Wexner) to travel to Abigail Plantation in Georgia, a quail-hunting preserve owned by Wexner. Epstein and Wexner went hunting.

events.title: North American Regional Meeting Invitation
events.description: Michael O'Neil invited Jeffrey Epstein to attend the 2005 North American regional meeting in Montreal on November 4-5.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Mentioned in passing as the year Epstein was arrested, with a note that he sent someone to South Africa afterward.

locations: Fort Lauderdale, FL, 33301 (Boies Schiller Flexner office)
Montreal (site of 2005 North American regional meeting)
London, Aspen (Wexner residences listed in Epstein's black book)
keyFacts: Epstein frequently used the email account '...@gmail.com' to communicate with people, a detail highlighted by legal staff for investigation.

Epstein had significant ties to L Brands (Victoria's Secret): he corresponded with executives, attended fashion shows, and models from the MC2 agency (which he courted) were guests on his private island.

Leslie Wexner provided Epstein with a Boeing 727 jet (with vanity plate 'JE') and access to his properties; Epstein's 'Little Black Book' contained dozens of contact numbers for Wexner and his associates.
A 2003 Vanity Fair article quoted Wexner praising Epstein's 'excellent judgment and unusually high standards' and calling him 'a most loyal friend.'
An internal email from attorneys suggests Epstein's assistant's email address could hold a 'treasure trove' of communications, indicating its importance for discovery.
